definition[0]: to give something or someone a name that describes them in some way
example[0]: The body, thousands of years old, was found in the Alps and dubbed ‘The Iceman’.
definition[1]: to change the original spoken language of a film or television programme into another language
example[1]: a British film dubbed into French
explanation[0]: Dub is usually passive in meanings 1 and 2
definition[2]: to make a record out of two or more different pieces of music or sound mixed together
definition[3]: to copy a recording from a tape or CD onto another tape
definition[4]: if a king or queen dubs someone, they give the title of knight to that person in a special ceremony
definition[5]: a style of poetry or music from the West Indies with a strong regular beat
